kanji.mnemonic:
If you think about being put in an old grave, being under all of that earth with no way out and eventually not being able to breathe due to running out of air... that's a terrifying thought, isn't it?
This kanji depicts this situation in a pictographic way — at the top we have the grave itself, and underneath is you, unable to breath.

kanji.mnemonic:
What do you do when your child just won't behave and absolutely refuses to study? You lock him up in a derelict hut deep in the forest, and force him to study under a roof full of tiny hairs which are — on a closer look — millions of tiny, hairy, disgusting caterpillars.
And since the hut's roof is so old and dilapidated it can collapse at any time. The threat of all of those creepy caterpillars falling on your child's head should really motivate him to study. The faster he studies the faster he'll be able to leave the hut!

kanji.mnemonic:
What do you do when your child just won't behave and absolutely refuses to study? You lock him up in a derelict hut deep in the forest, and force him to study under a roof full of tiny hairs which are — on a closer look — millions of tiny, hairy, disgusting caterpillars.
And since the hut's roof is so old and dilapidated it can collapse at any time. The threat of all of those creepy caterpillars falling on your child's head should really motivate him to study. The faster he studies the faster he'll be able to leave the hut!

It's a good thing I don't have a chimney through which it could get inside, but it still filled me with dread, with my heart racing like it never had before. A cryptic pictograph of a face trying to say something.

We have a mouth at the bottom, then we have two short lines signifying a nose (this person has a really long nose, hence two lines), then one long line for the eyes (this person has an eye visor just like RoboCop), and then the final line at the top to represent the forehead.

translations.translation: to say, to utter, to name, to call, to go (e.g. "the alarm went ping"), to make a noise
language, dialect, word, phrase, speech, (manner of) speaking
to be called ..., to be referred to as ...

phrases.phrase: あなたの虚言が、私を苦しめるんです。
translations: Your lies pain me.

translations.translation: cavity, hollow, void, hollow (voice, smile, etc.), blank (eyes, look, etc.), vacant (expression, stare, etc.)
to decorate, to ornament, to display, to exhibit, to mark (e.g. the day with a victory), to adorn (e.g. the front page)
to defend against, to protect against, to prevent, to avert, to avoid

kanji.mnemonic: A pictograph of an arm of a bodybuilder being bitten by an insect.

translations.translation: insect, bug, worm, roundworm, one's emotions, one's feelings, nervousness

phrases.phrase: がは灯に集まる。
translations: Moths are attracted by light.

phrases.phrase: それは蝶ですか、それとも蛾ですか。
translations: Is it a butterfly or a moth?

phrases.phrase: それは蝶ですか、それとも蛾ですか。
translations: Is it a butterfly or a moth?

translations.translation: beehive, hive, something full of holes, (fig.) Swiss cheese, honeycomb tripe, wall of a cow's second stomach

kanji.mnemonic:
If you run without paying too much attention an accident is bound to occur, usually to oneself.
(Imagine literally running into oneself reflected in a mirror.)

translations.translation: to get up, to rise, to wake up, to be awake, to occur (usu. of unfavourable incidents), to happen
to raise, to raise up, to wake, to wake up, to cause, to bring about, to start

phrases.phrase: 小作人達は領主に反抗して蜂起した。
translations: The peasants rose up in rebellion against the ruler.

translations.translation: agglutination, adhesion, fusion, combination, blending, uniting
lending (money), finance, loan, adaptability, versatility, flexibility
